Systematic mediastinal lymph node sampling was performed at the following stations:

Station 11R: Id[REDACTED] homogeneous lymph node measuring 8.4mm (short axis) x 34.2mm (long axis). 2 passes performed with 21G needle. ROSE: Granuloma.
Station 11L: Id[REDACTED] homogeneous lymph node measuring 22.2mm (short axis) x 34.6mm (long axis). 4 passes performed with 21G needle. ROSE: Malignant - adenocarcinoma.
Station 2R: Id[REDACTED] hypoechoic lymph node measuring 21.9mm (short axis) x 28.9mm (long axis). 4 passes performed with 21G needle. ROSE: Atypical cells.
Station 4L: Id[REDACTED] homogeneous lymph node measuring 18.5mm (short axis) x 22.0mm (long axis). 4 passes performed with 21G needle. ROSE: Granuloma.

PART 2: ROBOTIC BRONCHOSCOPY FOR PERIPHERAL LESION

Following completion of mediastinal staging, the Ion robotic bronchoscopy system was deployed.

Target lesion: RLL lateral basal (B9)
Lesion characteristics:
- Size: 28.6 mm
- Distance from pleura: 24.0 mm
- CT appearance: Ground-glass
- Bronchus sign: Negative
- PET SUV max: 8.9

Navigation was performed successfully with registration error < 3mm. The robotic catheter was advanced to the target location. Radial EBUS probe was deployed confirming adjacent view of the lesion.

Tool-in-lesion confirmation: Augmented fluoroscopy

Sampling performed:
- Transbronchial forceps biopsies: 5 specimens
- TBNA: 4 passes
- Brushings: 2 specimens

ROSE result from peripheral lesion: Malignant - adenocarcinoma
